clusters.neutral_headline: Baby dies of whooping cough after mother not vaccinated while pregnant: The first death from the illness this year comes as vaccination rates among children have declined

items.standfirst: The first death from the illness this year comes as vaccination rates among children have declined.
items.content: The first death from the illness this year comes as vaccination rates among children have declined.

items.title: British baby dies from whooping cough as vaccination rates fall
items.standfirst: Infant’s mother had not been vaccinated against the highly infectious disease, which affects the lungs and airwaysA baby in the UK has died from whooping cough, marking the first such death in the country this year.The infant’s mother had not been vaccinated against the highly infectious disease, which affects the lungs and airways. This death occurred as vaccination rates among children and pregnant women in the UK have fallen to their lowest levels in 15 years. Continue reading...
items.content: Infant’s mother had not been vaccinated against the highly infectious disease, which affects the lungs and airwaysA baby in the UK has died from whooping cough, marking the first such death in the country this year.The infant’s mother had not been vaccinated against the highly infectious disease, which affects the lungs and airways. This death occurred as vaccination rates among children and pregnant women in the UK have fallen to their lowest levels in 15 years. Continue reading...

The death highlights the importance of vaccination during pregnancy.

clusters.title: Three-minute test helps identify people at greater risk of Alzheimer’s, trial finds
clusters.neutral_headline: Three-minute test helps identify people at greater risk of Alzheimer’s, trial finds: Test detects memory problems linked to Alzheimer’s long before typical diagnosis, raising possibility of earlier drug interventionA three-minute brainwave test can detect memory problems linked to Alzheimer’s disease long before people are typically diagnosed, raising hopes that the approach could help identify those most likely to benefit from new drugs for the condition.In a small trial, the test flagged specific memory issues in people with mild cognitive impairment, highlighting who was at greater risk of developing Alzheimer’s. Trials in larger groups are under way. Continue reading

Trials in larger groups are under way. Continue reading...
items.content: Test detects memory problems linked to Alzheimer’s long before typical diagnosis, raising possibility of earlier drug interventionA three-minute brainwave test can detect memory problems linked to Alzheimer’s disease long before people are typically diagnosed, raising hopes that the approach could help identify those most likely to benefit from new drugs for the condition.In a small trial, the test flagged specific memory issues in people with mild cognitive impairment, highlighting who was at greater risk of developing Alzheimer’s. Trials in larger groups are under way. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A three-minute test identifies Alzheimer's risk early.
The test detects memory problems before typical diagnosis.
The test could help identify those who benefit from drugs.
The trial found specific memory issues in mild impairment.
Larger trials are underway to validate the test's accuracy.

clusters.title: At least 45,000 sites in Wales could be contaminated with toxic waste, study says
clusters.neutral_headline: At least 45,000 sites in Wales could be contaminated with toxic waste, study says: Campaigners say only 82 sites have been fully examined and classified as contaminated, so scale of threat not knownResearch from Friends of the Earth Cymru has found that at least 45,000 sites across Wales could be contaminated with toxic waste but have never been adequately inspected, leaving communities and wildlife vulnerable to a potential environmental crisis.Despite Wales’s extensive industrial history, Tuesday’s publication found that due to a lack of funding and oversight, only 82 sites across the country have ever been fully examined and classified as contaminated, meaning the actual scale of the threat is unknown. Continue reading

Continue reading...

clusters.title: Former CDC leaders slam RFK Jr for endangering Americans’ health
clusters.neutral_headline: Former CDC Leaders Criticize RFK Jr's Potential Leadership

items.title: Former CDC leaders slam RFK Jr for endangering Americans’ health
items.standfirst: In a New York Times essay, nine officials said Kennedy’s leadership at HHS ‘should alarm every American’Nine former officials at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention have said that Robert F Kennedy Jr’s leadership of the US health and human services department is “unlike anything our country has ever experienced” and “unacceptable”. They also warned that Kennedy’s leadership “should alarm every American, regardless of political leanings”.In a guest essay for the New York Times, the former CDC leaders said Kennedy’s actions were “unlike anything we have ever seen at the agency”. Continue reading...
items.content: In a New York Times essay, nine officials said Kennedy’s leadership at HHS ‘should alarm every American’Nine former officials at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention have said that Robert F Kennedy Jr’s leadership of the US health and human services department is “unlike anything our country has ever experienced” and “unacceptable”. They also warned that Kennedy’s leadership “should alarm every American, regardless of political leanings”.In a guest essay for the New York Times, the former CDC leaders said Kennedy’s actions were “unlike anything we have ever seen at the agency”. Continue reading...

items.title: Former CDC official ‘only sees harm’ to public health under RFK Jr’s leadership
items.standfirst: Demetre Daskalakis, who resigned after White House fired CDC chief, cautions against ‘undoing of vaccination’ to ABCThe former immunizations director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has warned of the future of American health under the leadership of Donald Trump’s health secretary, Robert F Kennedy Jr.In an interview on Sunday with ABC, Demetre Daskalakis – who resigned this week in protest over the White House’s firing of CDC director Susan Monarez – said: “From my vantage point as a doctor who’s taken the Hippocratic Oath, I only see harm coming.” Continue reading...
items.content: Demetre Daskalakis, who resigned after White House fired CDC chief, cautions against ‘undoing of vaccination’ to ABCThe former immunizations director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has warned of the future of American health under the leadership of Donald Trump’s health secretary, Robert F Kennedy Jr.In an interview on Sunday with ABC, Demetre Daskalakis – who resigned this week in protest over the White House’s firing of CDC director Susan Monarez – said: “From my vantage point as a doctor who’s taken the Hippocratic Oath, I only see harm coming.” Continue reading...

ai_summary: Nine former CDC officials expressed alarm regarding Robert F Kennedy Jr's potential leadership of HHS.
They stated his actions would be unlike anything the agency has ever experienced.
Officials warned that Kennedy's leadership should concern every American, regardless of political affiliation.
Demetre Daskalakis, former CDC immunizations director, sees only harm coming from Kennedy's leadership.
Daskalakis resigned in protest over the White House's firing of CDC director Susan Monarez.

clusters.title: Vaping may be causing irreversible harm to children’s health, doctors say

items.standfirst: Experts ‘extremely concerned’ about e-cigarette use and say millions of young people could face ill health in futureDoctors have raised the alarm about high levels of vaping among children worldwide, saying they are convinced e-cigarettes are causing irreversible harm to their health.Cardiologists, researchers and health experts said they were “extremely concerned” about the harmful effects of e-cigarettes on millions of teenagers and young people, including exposure to toxins and carcinogens – some of which are still unknown. clusters.title: Why more and more people are tuning the news out: ‘Now I don’t have that anxiety’
clusters.neutral_headline: People Tune Out News Due to Emotional Toll

items.title: Why more and more people are tuning the news out: ‘Now I don’t have that anxiety’
items.standfirst: Emotional toll of constant negative news and unlimited access to ‘doomscrolling’ has led to record-high news avoidanceNews has never been more accessible – but for some, that’s exactly the problem. Flooded with information and relentless updates, more and more people around the world are tuning out.The reasons vary: for some it’s the sheer volume of news, for others the emotional toll of negative headlines or a distrust of the media itself. In online forums devoted to mindfulness and mental health, people discuss how to step back, from setting limits to cutting the news out entirely. Continue reading...

Flooded with information and relentless updates, more and more people around the world are tuning out.The reasons vary: for some it’s the sheer volume of news, for others the emotional toll of negative headlines or a distrust of the media itself. In online forums devoted to mindfulness and mental health, people discuss how to step back, from setting limits to cutting the news out entirely. Continue reading...

ai_summary: More people are tuning out the news due to its emotional impact.

The sheer volume of news and distrust of media are also factors.

News has never been more accessible, but this is a problem for some.

clusters.title: The one change that worked: I got a period cup – and saved £120 a year
clusters.neutral_headline: Period Cup Saves Money and Reduces Stress

items.title: The one change that worked: I got a period cup – and saved £120 a year
items.standfirst: Ditching sanitary towels and tampons has made my period much less stressful. Crucially, it’s better for the environment tooI was 18 when I tried a menstrual cup for the first time. I was studying at the University of Edinburgh and Scotland had just become the first country in the world to make period products free to those who need them. The university health service was offering menstrual cups alongside the usual sanitary pads and tampons. I picked one up out of curiosity and because I just couldn’t resist a freebie.I was used to spending £10 to £15 a month on period products, more if I was caught short and had to do a panicked dash to an overpriced off-licence. As an eco-conscious teenager I already bought non-applicator tampons but often wore a security sanitary liner underneath. It was an attempt to keep the endless worry of heavy periods at bay: will I leak, run out of supplies, or find a clean loo in time? Even so, I leaked more often than I cared to admit. Continue reading...
items.content: Ditching sanitary towels and tampons has made my period much less stressful. Crucially, it’s better for the environment tooI was 18 when I tried a menstrual cup for the first time. I was studying at the University of Edinburgh and Scotland had just become the first country in the world to make period products free to those who need them. The university health service was offering menstrual cups alongside the usual sanitary pads and tampons. I picked one up out of curiosity and because I just couldn’t resist a freebie.I was used to spending £10 to £15 a month on period products, more if I was caught short and had to do a panicked dash to an overpriced off-licence. As an eco-conscious teenager I already bought non-applicator tampons but often wore a security sanitary liner underneath. It was an attempt to keep the endless worry of heavy periods at bay: will I leak, run out of supplies, or find a clean loo in time? Even so, I leaked more often than I cared to admit. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Using a period cup saved the author £120 per year.
Ditching pads and tampons made periods less stressful.
The author found the cup better for the environment.
The author was 18 when she first tried a menstrual cup.
She was used to spending £10-15 monthly on period products.

clusters.title: NHS corridor care now year-round crisis in England, experts say
clusters.neutral_headline: NHS Corridor Care Becomes Year-Round Crisis

items.title: NHS corridor care now year-round crisis in England, experts say
items.standfirst: About 74,150 patients waited at least 12 hours on trolleys in June and July, a situation almost nonexistent 10 years agoCorridor care in the NHS is now a year-round crisis, experts have warned, as analysis showed nearly 3 million patients attended A&E over the first two months of the summer.The latest NHS figures in England, analysed by the Liberal Democrats, show that since 2015 the number of people going to A&E in June and July has increased 15% to 2.9 million – the highest level recorded over the past decade. Continue reading...
items.content: About 74,150 patients waited at least 12 hours on trolleys in June and July, a situation almost nonexistent 10 years agoCorridor care in the NHS is now a year-round crisis, experts have warned, as analysis showed nearly 3 million patients attended A&E over the first two months of the summer.The latest NHS figures in England, analysed by the Liberal Democrats, show that since 2015 the number of people going to A&E in June and July has increased 15% to 2.9 million – the highest level recorded over the past decade. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Experts warn that corridor care in the NHS is now a year-round crisis.
Nearly 3 million patients attended A&E over the summer months.
Approximately 74,150 patients waited at least 12 hours on trolleys.
The number of A&E visits in June and July has increased since 2015.
The situation is significantly worse than it was a decade ago.

clusters.title: Top FDA official demands removal of YouTube videos in which he criticized Covid vaccines
clusters.neutral_headline: Top FDA official demands removal of YouTube videos in which he criticized Covid vaccines

items.title: Top FDA official demands removal of YouTube videos in which he criticized Covid vaccines
items.standfirst: Channel was an attempt to ‘preserve’ what Trump officials in current Trump administration said during the pandemicA top official at the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) demanded the removal of YouTube videos of himself that were published by a physician and writer who has been critical of medical misinformation and public health officials in the Trump administration, according to a YouTube notice that was seen by the Guardian.Jonathan Howard, a neurologist and psychiatrist in New York City, received an email from YouTube on Friday night, which stated that Vinay Prasad, who is the FDA’s top vaccine regulator, had demanded the removal of six videos of himself from Howard’s YouTube channel. Continue reading...
items.content: Channel was an attempt to ‘preserve’ what Trump officials in current Trump administration said during the pandemicA top official at the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) demanded the removal of YouTube videos of himself that were published by a physician and writer who has been critical of medical misinformation and public health officials in the Trump administration, according to a YouTube notice that was seen by the Guardian.Jonathan Howard, a neurologist and psychiatrist in New York City, received an email from YouTube on Friday night, which stated that Vinay Prasad, who is the FDA’s top vaccine regulator, had demanded the removal of six videos of himself from Howard’s YouTube channel. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A top FDA official demanded removal of YouTube videos of himself.
The videos were published by a physician critical of vaccine information.
The official, Vinay Prasad, is the FDA's top vaccine regulator.
The videos were on a channel run by Jonathan Howard.
The videos were removed from Howard's YouTube channel.

clusters.title: Vegan v carnivore diets – the jury is out | Letters
clusters.neutral_headline: Vegan and Carnivore Diets Debated in Letters

items.title: Vegan v carnivore diets – the jury is out | Letters
items.standfirst: Anne Tropper advocates nose-to-tail eating, while Rendel Harris says going vegan is the only way to be kind to other speciesA “bowl of cereal with skimmed milk, a Greek yoghurt and a lean chicken breast” – doesn’t that epitomise a “fad diet” (The Guardian view on the carnivore diet: red meat for influencers, but bad news for health, 25 August)? Ultraprocessed, unsustainable and wasteful – what is supposed to happen to most of the chicken and the precious dairy fat? I shall be sticking to the nose-to-tail red meat, butter and eggs that have restored my health. I suspect that this trend is powered by personal experience more than by influencers. Anne TropperRopley, Hampshire• Adele Parks’ account of converting to pescatarianism explains how she demonstrated for “beauty without cruelty” (A moment that changed me: I gave up meat at 16 – and learned how to say no, 27 August). But, as she still eats fish and dairy, she apparently doesn’t believe in food without cruelty. If you really want to be kind to other species, go vegan. Otherwise you’re simply saying that your form of cruelty is acceptable while others aren’t.Rendel HarrisLondon Continue reading...
items.content: Anne Tropper advocates nose-to-tail eating, while Rendel Harris says going vegan is the only way to be kind to other speciesA “bowl of cereal with skimmed milk, a Greek yoghurt and a lean chicken breast” – doesn’t that epitomise a “fad diet” (The Guardian view on the carnivore diet: red meat for influencers, but bad news for health, 25 August)? Ultraprocessed, unsustainable and wasteful – what is supposed to happen to most of the chicken and the precious dairy fat? I shall be sticking to the nose-to-tail red meat, butter and eggs that have restored my health. I suspect that this trend is powered by personal experience more than by influencers. Anne TropperRopley, Hampshire• Adele Parks’ account of converting to pescatarianism explains how she demonstrated for “beauty without cruelty” (A moment that changed me: I gave up meat at 16 – and learned how to say no, 27 August). But, as she still eats fish and dairy, she apparently doesn’t believe in food without cruelty. If you really want to be kind to other species, go vegan. Otherwise you’re simply saying that your form of cruelty is acceptable while others aren’t.Rendel HarrisLondon Continue reading...

ai_summary: Letters discuss the merits of vegan versus carnivore diets.
One letter advocates for nose-to-tail eating for health.
Another letter argues that veganism is the only kind option.
The debate centers on the ethical and health aspects of diets.
The letters reflect differing views on food choices.

clusters.title: Teachers must be trained to use defibrillators to keep our children safe | Letter
clusters.neutral_headline: Teachers Should Be Trained to Use Defibrillators

items.title: Teachers must be trained to use defibrillators to keep our children safe | Letter
items.standfirst: Mark King urges the government to provide training on this life-saving equipment as the school year beginsChildren across England are preparing to return to school this week following the summer break, but parents should be concerned for their safety and wellbeing while they are in school.After years of campaigning after the tragic death of my son Oliver to sudden cardiac arrest, I strongly welcomed the commitment given by the previous government to ensure that all state-funded schools across England received life-saving defibrillators. The rollout of the programme was significant and marked a giant step forward in improving emergency medical readiness, and potentially saving lives in schools across England. Continue reading...
items.content: Mark King urges the government to provide training on this life-saving equipment as the school year beginsChildren across England are preparing to return to school this week following the summer break, but parents should be concerned for their safety and wellbeing while they are in school.After years of campaigning after the tragic death of my son Oliver to sudden cardiac arrest, I strongly welcomed the commitment given by the previous government to ensure that all state-funded schools across England received life-saving defibrillators. The rollout of the programme was significant and marked a giant step forward in improving emergency medical readiness, and potentially saving lives in schools across England. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A letter urges the government to train teachers on defibrillators.
The letter writer's son died from sudden cardiac arrest.
The writer welcomed the commitment to provide defibrillators.
Training teachers could potentially save lives in schools.
The letter emphasizes the importance of emergency preparedness.

clusters.title: Doctors find drug that is better than aspirin at preventing heart attacks
clusters.neutral_headline: Drug Found Better Than Aspirin for Heart Attacks

items.title: Doctors find drug that is better than aspirin at preventing heart attacks
items.standfirst: Discovery that clopidogrel is a more effective blood thinner could transform health guidelines worldwideDoctors have found a drug that is better than aspirin at preventing heart attacks and strokes, in a discovery that could transform health guidelines worldwide.For decades, millions of people have been advised to take aspirin to reduce their risk of experiencing a serious cardiovascular event. A daily low-dose aspirin makes blood less sticky and helps prevent heart attacks and strokes. Continue reading...
items.content: Discovery that clopidogrel is a more effective blood thinner could transform health guidelines worldwideDoctors have found a drug that is better than aspirin at preventing heart attacks and strokes, in a discovery that could transform health guidelines worldwide.For decades, millions of people have been advised to take aspirin to reduce their risk of experiencing a serious cardiovascular event. A daily low-dose aspirin makes blood less sticky and helps prevent heart attacks and strokes. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Doctors found a drug better than aspirin for preventing heart attacks.
The drug, clopidogrel, is a more effective blood thinner.
The discovery could transform health guidelines worldwide.
Aspirin has been a standard recommendation for decades.
The new drug offers improved protection against cardiovascular events.

clusters.title: Is it depression or an iron deficiency? - podcast
clusters.neutral_headline: Podcast Discusses Iron Deficiency Misdiagnosis and Potential Solutions

items.title: Is it depression or an iron deficiency? - podcast
items.standfirst: Treating an iron deficiency can be elusive and frustrating. That’s particularly true for women who may have been misdiagnosed with depression and other chronic illnesses, until those low iron levels are finally picked up.Reged Ahmad speaks to health reporter Natasha May on why so many women have to wait years to find out what’s wrong, and whether a new test could be the solutionRead more:• Misdiagnosis of iron deficiency can lead to years of debilitating illness. Could nanodiamonds be the solution? Continue reading...
items.content: Treating an iron deficiency can be elusive and frustrating. That’s particularly true for women who may have been misdiagnosed with depression and other chronic illnesses, until those low iron levels are finally picked up.Reged Ahmad speaks to health reporter Natasha May on why so many women have to wait years to find out what’s wrong, and whether a new test could be the solutionRead more:• Misdiagnosis of iron deficiency can lead to years of debilitating illness. Could nanodiamonds be the solution? Continue reading...

ai_summary: Iron deficiency can be misdiagnosed, leading to years of illness, especially for women.
Health reporter Natasha May discusses the challenges of diagnosing and treating iron deficiency.
The podcast explores why diagnosis often takes years for many women.
The podcast considers whether new tests, like those using nanodiamonds, could help.
Treating iron deficiency can be difficult, causing frustration for those affected.

clusters.title: RFK Jr says he’ll ‘fix’ a vaccine program - by canceling compensation for people with vaccine injuries
clusters.neutral_headline: RFK Jr says he’ll ‘fix’ a vaccine program - by canceling compensation for people with vaccine injuries

items.title: RFK Jr says he’ll ‘fix’ a vaccine program - by canceling compensation for people with vaccine injuries
items.standfirst: Changes to an injury compensation program could make it hard to keep vaccines on the market – or make new onesWhile unrest and new vaccine restrictions have kept US health agencies in headlines, there’s one vaccine program in particular that Robert F Kennedy Jr, secretary of the US Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), recently vowed to “fix”, which experts say could further upend the vaccine industry and prevent people experiencing rare side effects from vaccines from getting financial help.While some changes to the National Vaccine Injury Compensation Program (VICP), which compensates people who suffer very rare side effects from vaccination, must come from Congress, Kennedy could take several actions to reshape or affect the program’s operations. Continue reading...
items.content: Changes to an injury compensation program could make it hard to keep vaccines on the market – or make new onesWhile unrest and new vaccine restrictions have kept US health agencies in headlines, there’s one vaccine program in particular that Robert F Kennedy Jr, secretary of the US Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), recently vowed to “fix”, which experts say could further upend the vaccine industry and prevent people experiencing rare side effects from vaccines from getting financial help.While some changes to the National Vaccine Injury Compensation Program (VICP), which compensates people who suffer very rare side effects from vaccination, must come from Congress, Kennedy could take several actions to reshape or affect the program’s operations. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Robert F Kennedy Jr. plans to alter the National Vaccine Injury Compensation Program (VICP).
Kennedy's actions could disrupt the vaccine industry and impact vaccine availability.
VICP provides financial aid to individuals experiencing rare vaccine side effects.
Changes to VICP could make it harder to keep vaccines on the market.
Some changes to VICP require Congressional approval, but Kennedy has options.
